title: Cargo plane slides off runway in Hong Kong, media reports two dead
byline: A cargo plane flying from Dubai skidded off the runway into the sea while landing at Hong Kong International Airport early on Monday, the city’s airport operator said, with local media reporting the deaths of two people.

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: A low-level atmospheric disturbance has developed over the south east of the Island, today (20), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Flood warnings issued for low-lying areas of Deduru Oya
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a flood warning for several low-lying areas of Deduru Oya valley due to heavy rainfall catchment areas.

title: President Anura Kumara’s Deepavali message
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his message for the 2025 Deepavali Festival, says that the festival symbolises the triumph of righteousness and light over darkness, inspiring all to overcome challenges with unity and hope.

title: Israel says it will return to ceasefire after Gaza strikes
byline: The Israeli military has said it will resume enforcement of the ceasefire in Gaza after launching air strikes on Sunday in response to what it called Hamas’s “blatant violation” of the deal.

title: 30-hour water cut in several areas of Galle District today
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced that a 30-hour water cut will be implemented in several areas of the Galle District today (20).

title: ‘May this Deepavali guide us toward wisdom that will sprout seeds of economic revival and reconciliation’ – PM
byline: In her message for the 2025 Deepavali Festival, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya notes that Deepavali signifies the triumph of light over darkness and comes at a time when Sri Lanka is beginning to rise from a period of economic and social hardship with renewed hope and determination.

title: Suspect arrested with over 9kg of Kush in Grandpass
byline: A person was arrested in the Grandpass area of Colombo while in possession of 9 kilograms and 555 grams of Kush cannabis, police said.

title: Youth arrested with over 350,000 narcotic tablets in Vavuniya
byline: Vavuniya Police have arrested a suspect in possession of 359,000 narcotic tablets concealed within a consignment of dried fish unfit for human consumption.

title: True spirit of Deepavali lies in awakening the light of truth and knowledge – Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa, in his Deepavali message, called on all Sri Lankans to use the festival of lights as an opportunity to triumph over evil and foster goodness within society.

title: Proceeds of Crime Investigation Division of Sri Lanka Police launched
byline: Sri Lanka Police has officially inaugurated the Proceeds of Crime Investigation Division (PCID), today (20).

title: 03 arrested for illegal excavation of artifacts in Nikaweratiya
byline: Three suspects have been arrested for their involvement in the illegal excavations in search of artifacts on private land in the Pinnapolegama area under the Nikaweratiya Police Division.

title: Irrigation Dept. warns of flood risks as reservoir levels rise across the country
byline: The Irrigation Department states that the water levels of reservoirs in many areas across the country have increased rapidly due to the heavy rainfall experienced over the past few days.

title: Sri Lankan sailor among 3 dead after landing craft capsizes near Maldives
byline: The death toll from the capsize of a landing craft that set off from Male’ City with a crew of seven people on Thursday has risen to three, as the body of the third sailor who went missing in the harrowing incident was found afloat in the waters of K. Atoll.

title: GovPay spot fine system launched in Southern Province
byline: The police have announced that online payments of spot fines for traffic violations through GovPay will be rolled out in the Southern Province starting today (20).

title: Centrist Rodrigo Paz wins Bolivian presidency, ending nearly 20 years of leftist rule
byline: Centrist Rodrigo Paz won Bolivia’s presidential runoff on Sunday, defeating conservative rival Jorge “Tuto” Quiroga, as the country’s worst economic crisis in a generation helped propel the end of nearly two decades of leftist rule.

title: Another seven train journeys canceled due to derailment on Main Line
byline: The Department of Railways has cancelled another seven train journeys today (20), including the night mail train, following a train derailment along the Upcountry Main Railway Line.

title: Over 100 families in three districts affected by adverse weather
byline: More than 100 families in three districts have been affected by prevailing adverse weather conditions across the country.

title: Advisory issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: An ‘Amber’ weather advisory has been issued for strong winds and rough seas by the Department of Meteorology.

title: IGP urges police officers not to misuse their powers
byline: Inspector General of Police (IGP) Priyantha Weerasooriya has requested all police officers to exercise the powers granted to them in a manner that upholds the rule of law in the country and serves the well-being of the public, without misusing them.

title: US State Department confirms DV-2027 delay and new $1 registration fee
byline: The US Department of State has confirmed a delay in the opening of registration for the Diversity Visa (DV) 2027 program, which typically begins in the first week of October.

title: Sri Lanka showcases economic reform & debt restructuring progress at IMF-World Bank meetings
byline: The Sri Lankan delegation, led by Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe, Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), actively participated in a series of high-level bilateral and multilateral meetings during the 2025 World Bank Group/ International Monetary Fund (IMF) Annual Meetings in Washington, D.C., during October 13–18, 2025.

title: Amazon cloud platform and several other websites experiencing outages
byline: A major cloud computing service went offline early Monday, causing problems for thousands of websites and services including leading retailers, publishers and games.

title: Indian PM celebrates Diwali onboard warship with armed forces
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi kept up his annual tradition of celebrating Diwali with the Indian armed forces and spent the festival of lights with the Navy personnel onboard INS Vikrant off the coast of Goa and Karwar (Karnataka) on Monday.

title: More trains cancelled as restoration work continues after derailment on upcountry line
byline: The Railway Departments states that the restoration of train services on the upcountry line following yesterday’s derailment, caused by a mound of earth collapsing on the Intercity Express train travelling from Kandy to Colombo Fort near the Ihalakotte Railway Station, may be further delayed.

title: Zelensky ready to join Trump-Putin talks if invited
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has said he would be ready to join Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin at a proposed summit in Hungary if he were invited.

title: Orionid meteor shower visible in Sri Lanka tonight
byline: Sri Lankans will be able to witness the Orionid meteor shower, formed from Halley’s Comet debris, tonight (20) and tomorrow (21), with peak visibility expected before dawn.

title: Driving License fee at BIA increased from Rs. 2,000 to Rs. 15,000
byline: The government has decided to increase the fee for obtaining a driving license issued at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) from Rs. 2,000 to Rs. 15,000.

title: Several reservoirs overflowing due to heavy rainfall
byline: Fourteen major tanks across the country are overflowing due to prevailing heavy rainfall, the Department of Irrigation stated.

title: More trains from Kandy to Colombo canceled due to landslides and derailment
byline: Train operations along the upcountry main railway line continue to be disrupted due to a landslide that caused debris to fall onto the tracks and a train derailment near the Ihalakotte railway station.

title: Excise trade unions strongly opposes statement by Commissioner General
byline: Trade unions attached to the Excise Department have expressed strong opposition to a statement made by the Commissioner General of Excise, during a trade union meeting held on Friday (17).

title: Three including police constable remanded for aiding Ishara Sewwandi to evade arrest
byline: Three individuals, including a police constable, who were arrested for allegedly aiding Ishara Sewwandi, a key suspect in the ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder case, by helping her evade arrest have been remanded.

title: Indonesian students stage protest as President Prabowo marks a year in office
byline: Indonesian students protested in Jakarta on Monday as President Prabowo Subianto completed a year in office, two months after violent demonstrations nationwide, with one expert faulting the government on grounds of openness and public participation.

title: Sri Lanka’s FDI records 138% increase in first nine months of 2025
byline: Foreign Direct Investment inflows including foreign commercial loans for investments to BOI-approved enterprises have reached USD 827 million during the period January to September 2025, the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka has announced today.

title: President, FUTA hold talks on pressing issues within university system
byline: A meeting between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and academics of the Federation of University Teachers’ Unions (FUTA) was held this morning (20) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Second and third year Agri Faculty students of Ruhuna University directed to vacate the premises
byline: A clash has erupted between second-year and third-year students of the Faculty of Agriculture at the University of Ruhuna.

title: Landslide warnings issued to residents of nine districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued to residents of multiple areas in nine districts owing to incessant rains experienced in parts of the island.

title: Iraq bans US gaming platform Roblox over child safety concerns
byline: Iraq has banned US user-generated videogame platform Roblox due to concerns over child abuse, the government said, joining other countries in cracking down on virtual worlds.

title: US government shutdown likely to end this week: White House adviser
byline: The 20-day United States federal government shutdown is likely to end this week, White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said on Monday (Oct 20).

title: Three including police constable remanded for sheltering Ishara Sewwandi
byline: Three individuals, including a police constable, who were arrested for allegedly aiding Ishara Sewwandi, a key suspect in the ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder case, by helping her evade arrest have been remanded.

title: Three dead, over 100 families affected due to adverse weather
byline: Three individuals have died due to disasters caused by the prevailing adverse weather conditions affecting various parts of the island, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) stated.

title: South Eastern University students urge authorities to address lack of hostel facilities
byline: Students of the 2022/23 batch of the Faculty of Applied Sciences at the South Eastern University of Sri Lanka have urged authorities to promptly provide solutions to the lack of hostel facilities within the campus.
